PUBLIC "-//David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library//TEXT (US::NDD::::J. Walter Thompson Company. Ed George Papers)//EN" "jwtdetroitgeorge" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.xsl (sy2003-10-15). Renamed "jwtgeorgeed" 2009.

Also, the top level of the finding aid (above the dsc) changed to conform to current Rubenstein Library and NC EAD standards as laid out in the Inventory Style Guide and in the NCEAD Best Practice Guidelines. Within the dsc, dates for series were normalized. These changes were made by Michelle Belden.
Also, container TYPE and LABEL attribute values were standardized according to the Rubenstein Library EAD 2002 manual and the NCEAD eadlocal.ent by Ruth E. Bryan.
The tag list inside index was changed to indexentry by Ruth E. Bryan.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
In addition, some of the materials in this collection are not immediately accessible, because they require further processing before use.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. There may be a 48-hour delay in obtaining these materials.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], J. Walter Thompson Company. Ed George Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Ed George Papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a transfer in 2001, with a subsequent gift in 2009.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Encoded by Rick Collier and Elizabeth Arnold
Accession 2009-0102 added by Meghan Lyon, November 2009
This collection is unprocessed: materials may have not been ordered and described beyond their original condition.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The J. Walter Thompson Company was founded in New York, N.Y., in 1864, and is one of the world's largest advertising agencies.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Ed George was a longtime executive for JWT, serving in a number of offices. The collection contains an assortment of items reflecting his creative career, comprising primarily finished advertisements for a variety of clients, in formats including videotapes of commercials, filmstrips, reel-to-reel audio tapes, and print advertisements. Also includes ad mockups; package designs; original art; billboard sheets; and other advertising memorabilia. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

Accession (2009-0102) (4.0 lin. ft.; 500 items; dated 1960s-1990s) includes George's sketches, mockups, and drafts for print, billboard, and television commercial advertisements created for JWT, FC&B, and Playboy. Also includes original art and comics for Car and Driver magazine.
